intro: Micrandra glabra, commonly known as the smooth micrandra, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically smooth and glabrous. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets and white ray florets. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
